ul.li1: 1Look! Yahweh is about to lay the earth waste
ul.li2: and is about to devastate it,
ul.li1: and he will twist her surface,
ul.li2: and he will scatter her inhabitants.
ul.li1: 2And it shall be as with the people, so with the priest;
ul.li2: as with the slave, so with his master;
ul.li1: as with the female slave, so with her mistress;
ul.li2: as with the buyer, so with the seller;
ul.li1: as with the lender, so with the borrower;
ul.li2: as with the creditor, so with the one to whom he lends.
ul.li1: 3The earth shall be utterly laid waste,
ul.li2: and it shall be utterly plundered,

chapter.p: for Yahweh has spoken this word.

ul.li1: 4The earth dries up, it withers;
ul.li2: the world languishes, it withers.
ul.li1: The elevated of the people of the earth languish,
ul.li2: 5and the earth is defiled beneath its inhabitants.
ul.li1: For they have transgressed laws;
ul.li2: they have passed by statutes;Hebrew “statute”
they have broken the everlasting covenant.
ul.li1: 6Therefore a curse devours the earth,
ul.li2: and the inhabitants in it suffer for their guilt.
ul.li1: Therefore the inhabitants of the earth burn,
ul.li2: and few men are left.Literally “he is left a man of smallness”
ul.li1: 7The new wine dries up;
ul.li2: the vine languishes.
ul.li1: All the merry of heart sigh;
ul.li2: 8the joy of the tambourine has stopped.
ul.li1: The noise of the jubilant has ceased;
ul.li2: the joy of the lyre has stopped.
ul.li1: 9They do not drink wine with song;
ul.li2: strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.
ul.li1: 10The city of emptiness is broken;
ul.li2: every house is shut so that no one can enter;Literally “from entering”
11there is an outcry over the wine in the streets.
ul.li1: All joy turns into darkness;Literally “evening”
ul.li2: the joy of the earth disappears.
ul.li1: 12Desolation is left in the city;
ul.li2: the gate is crushed into a state of ruin.
ul.li1: 13For it shall be like this in the midst of the earth,
ul.li2: among the nations,
ul.li1: like the beating of an olive tree,
ul.li2: like gleanings when a grape harvest is at an end.
ul.li1: 14They lift up their voices;Hebrew “voice” they sing for joy;
ul.li2: they shout out from the west over the majesty of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 15Therefore glorify Yahweh in the east,
ul.li2: the name of Yahweh the God of Israel in the coastlands of the sea.
ul.li1: 16We hear songs from the edgeLiterally “wing” of the earth:
ul.li2: “Glory to the righteous one!”
ul.li1: But I say, “Ruin to me!
ul.li2: Ruin to me! Woe to me!
ul.li1: The treacherous ones deal treacherously,
ul.li2: and the treacherous ones deal treacherously with treachery!”

chapter.p: 17Terror and the pit and the snare are upon you, inhabitantsHebrew “inhabitant” of the earth!

ul.li1: The one who flees from the sound of the terror shall fall into the pit,
ul.li2: and the one who goes up from inside the pitLiterally “the middle of the pit” shall be caught in the snare,
ul.li1: for the windows from heaven are opened,
ul.li2: and the foundations of the earth tremble.
ul.li1: 19The earth is utterly broken;
ul.li2: the earth is torn asunder;
the earth is shaken violently.
ul.li1: 20The earth staggers to and fro like the drunkard,
ul.li2: and it sways like a hut,
ul.li1: and its transgression is heavy upon it,
ul.li2: and it falls and does not rise again.

chapter.p: 21And this shall happen on that day:

ul.li1: Yahweh will punish the host of heaven in heaven,
ul.li2: and the kings of the earth on the earth.
ul.li1: 22And they will be gathered in a gathering, like a prisoner inLiterally “on” a pit.
ul.li2: And they will be shut inLiterally “on” a prison and be punished afterLiterally “from” many days.
ul.li1: 23And the full moon will be ashamed
ul.li2: and the sun will be ashamed,
ul.li1: for Yahweh of hosts will rule on Mount ZionLiterally “the mountain of Zion” and in Jerusalem,
ul.li2: and before his elders in glory.
